entry.title: New Developer- and SAP-Technology Forums/Groups
entry.content:
Dear "Application Development and Automation" group members/subscribers, 

In case you haven't seen the general announcement post that went out earlier this week, this blog post is to inform you that we launched a pilot of new developer- and SAP-technology related forums/groups this week.

For you, this means that while the pilot runs, the "Application Development and Automation" group is set to read-only.
We would like to encourage you to go to our new developer forums/groups, if you would like to ask or answer questions, or publish blog posts, on development/technology-related topics. 

There are a number of different reasons why we would like to test these new forums/groups: 

  1. Since our platform migration last year, we have received feedback that you didn't know where to go to find topics like ABAP, Integration or UI5. With these new developer forums/groups, we hope we have made it easier for you to find the technology topics you are most interested in.

  2. We noticed that the discussion board in this group was used to ask development related-questions. Generally, everyone has been very helpful answering questions asked here. However, our interest groups are for having conversations with, and connecting to, like-minded people around shared interests. This is why these groups have discussion boards (= for conversations) and blog posts, instead of Q&As/forums. Therefore, when someone asks a question in the "Application Development and Automation" discussion board, it is not possible for the author to accept the right answer as a solution. This again means, that if someone with the same problem comes to the community to get help later on, they will not be able to see what the solution to the problem was.
    Which brings us to no. 3 below:

  3. Because answers to questions in discussion (conversation) boards won't have accepted solutions, we are also not able to give credit to, or celebrate, the members who took the time to help answer questions.

  4. With the new developer forums, authors can accept any answer as a correct solution, which means we will be able to bring back our topic expert leaderboards, and give proper credit to our members who answer questions.

  5. A new denser forum feed, with no preview of content, making it easier to scroll down the feed to look for the questions you can help answer: 


  6. New filter for "Questions with no answers". 
    This long-requested filter has now been added to all new Developers forums, so that you can find all questions with. no answers on a specific topic with one click: 
  7. We can now highlight important product announcements, or other valuable content, you shouldn't miss, around your favourite development topics by using the "Featured Topics" section for the individual topics.

  8. Better subscription management.
    You will now be able to subscribe to either all developer/SAP-technology related content, or drill down to and only subscribe to the specific parts that interest you the most:
    1. Developers https://community.sap.com/t5/developers/ct-p/developers - here you can subscribe to the whole category, this subscription sends you notifications on the platform and email notifications according to your account settings. 
    2. The individual groups, with both the Forums and Blog posts - here taking ABAP Cloud as an example: https://community.sap.com/t5/abap-cloud/gh-p/abap-cloud - here you have the same subscribe option as above. If you subscribe to content here, it will send you notifications on the platform and email notifications according to your account settings. 
    3. The individual group boards, ABAP Cloud Forum: https://community.sap.com/t5/abap-cloud-forum/bd-p/abap-cloudforum-board - here you have both the option to Subscribe and Subscribe to RSS Feed. The Subscribe option is the same as the two options above, and the RSS Feed is the one you are looking for. 
      You will find the same options for the blog posts boards as well: https://community.sap.com/t5/abap-cloud-blog-posts/bg-p/abap-cloudblog-board


If you missed the main announcement post, you can find more information in this What's New blog post. 

We hope you hop over to the new Developer groups to try them out 🙂 
If you have any feedback to us on the forums, you can provide it in the comments section on the What's New post linked above.

entry.title: Re: Exporting Plan Data from SAC to SAP S/4HANA
entry.content:
@Sotiris_X 

Export from SAC to ACDOCP in S4 is always in Overwrite mode. The plan data scope (or deletion scope) defines the plan data record set that will be reversed (overwritten) by the exported plan data record. Existing plan data in the SAP S/4HANA or S/4HANA Cloud system that contains any combination of the values of these dimensions will be reversed (overwritten) before the exported data is posted. You can control what data will be deleted by defining the plan data scope. You can refer to the below to understand how plan data scope can be used to control what data gets reversed before SAC data is loaded to S4.

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_ON-PREMISE/48f4b4785b8e45938ac44a67be8032d9/dd1d244504d44d928d3da20f710a7bd1.html

Hope this helps !!

Nikhil

entry.title: Re: Excluding Down Payments from CO Value Type 12 on WBS...
entry.content:
Why SAP Posts Down Payments to CO is because, SAP Project System (PS) is tightly integrated with CO. Any financial transaction on a WBS element (including down payments) is mirrored in CO to maintain a complete picture of project-related commitments and liquidity. Value type 12 (down payments): This is a statistical posting in CO. It doesn’t affect actual costs but ensures visibility for project reporting, budget checks, and cash flow analysis.

Why You See the Error (FI660) is because, when you omit customizing in OKEP (default cost elements) and KANK (number ranges for CO documents), the system cannot generate the required CO line item. SAP enforces this because every FI posting to a WBS must have a CO counterpart, even if only statistical.

So the Key takeaway is the note is “valid” for S/4HANA in terms of documentation, but the correction instructions are obsolete because the fix is already embedded in your release. That’s why you can’t implement it, and why SAP still enforces the CO posting logic for down payments.

So to conclude, the only supported workaround remains:

  • Maintain a dummy cost element in OKEP/KANK for KAZO.
  • Exclude that cost element (or value type 12) from your reporting and budget checks.

entry.title: Re: Why asset doest not have material code in SAP ERP?
entry.content:
Hello @nithin_pranesh 

What’s standard in S/4HANA Public Cloud (J62)? J62 covers the integrated asset acquisition process with purchasing; the asset master exists before GR, allowing GR/IR and invoice to link to the correct asset, which is how the J62 test flow is written

SAP’s External Asset Acquisitions describes the PO/invoice-integrated acquisition options; enrichment of the asset master is handled in Manage Fixed Assets afterwards. SAP Help Portal-External Asset Acquisitions

SAP KBA guidance for J62 prerequisites transfer date, etc confirms that the Public Cloud process is guided by the J62 setup, rather than by a “create at GR” switch. Currently, there is no documented setting to delay the automatic creation of GR.  SAP Support Portal-3119457 - Not able to create asset using the Manage Fixed Asset app - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

Why serial and technical details often come later. Serial numbers and equipment can be created or assigned during Goods Receipt, after which those technical objects are linked to the asset. That’s why detailed identifiers are usually added after the PO. Learn SAP Dermo-How to Create Serial Numbers using a Goods Receipt

Bottom line confirmed. In Public Cloud with J62, the planned process is that the asset exists by the time you post GR and invoice; you then enrich missing fields later to manage the Fixed Assets equipment link. There is no SAP-documented option in Public Cloud to transfer the automatic asset creation from PO to GR.

Let me know if you need further support

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: HCM Brasil - Crédito do Trabalhador - Provisão para o Terceiro Mês de Férias
entry.content:
Olá pessoal, 

Temos novidades empolgantes para compartilhar sobre o Crédito do Trabalhador! Para concluir as entregas previstas, estamos trazendo uma atualização significativa para a função de folha de pagamento BRPID, em conformidade com a Portaria 435/2025 do Governo Brasileiro. 

Provisão para Férias de Três Meses 

Agora, o sistema está preparado para lidar com férias que se estendem por três meses, o que pode ocorrer quando o funcionário inicia um período de 30 dias de férias em 31/01. Nesse caso, as férias podem abranger até 01/03. Com essa atualização, a provisão necessária para o terceiro mês também é realizada. 

Além disso, a funcionalidade existente permite realizar provisões para os meses subsequentes de férias utilizando a parcela correspondente ao mês atual. Isso garante que as operações de RH sejam mais eficientes e precisas. 

Para entender melhor essa solução, você pode consultar a SAP Note: 3655951 - eConsignado - Provisioning of IT3453 Amounts for Third Month on Vacation Payroll.

Essa melhoria faz parte do compromisso da SAP em apoiar os usuários de RH na otimização de suas operações. 

Se você gostou deste post, não esqueça de dar um Like e compartilhar com seus colegas. Para mais informações sobre o Crédito do Trabalhador, acesse nosso workzone exclusivo.  

Estamos ansiosos para ouvir seu feedback, comentários ou perguntas sobre este post. E não se esqueça de seguir a tag HCM Payroll Brazil na SAP Community para ficar por dentro das últimas novidades. 

Um abraço,   

Gabriel Pereira 

Time de HCM Brasil

entry.title: Re: Incorrect Creation Time Displayed in Billing Document...
entry.content:
Why the time mismatch occurs is because, SAP internally stores timestamps in UTC (Coordinated Universal Time). When you view a document in VF03, SAP converts this UTC time to your local time using the time zone settings configured in the system. If the time zone settings in your user profile or system configuration are incorrect or misaligned, the displayed time will not match your actual local time. This issue is not user-specific because the system-wide time zone configuration (application server or client settings) affects all users.

Areas to check

In SU01, under Default tab, check what time zone is maintained. Ensure, it reflects your local time zone.

Go to transaction STZAC to check the system time zone configuration. The system time zone should match the location of your SAP application server or be aligned with your business requirement.

Finally, refer to SAP Note 741734 for guidance on correcting time zone inconsistencies. Also review SAP Notes 481835 and 101726 for deeper analysis of UTC timer and time zone settings.

entry.title: Re: Unable to set user-defined currency type as a functio...
entry.content:
You cannot use a user-defined currency type (like Z1) as a functional currency in SAP because functional currency must be an FI-relevant currency type predefined by SAP, such as 10, 30, or 60 and that is why, you were getting the error FINS_ACDOC_CUST237. SAP only allows predefined currency types (like 10 = company code currency, 30 = group currency, 60 = global currency) to be used as functional currencies. User-defined currency types (Z) are considered freely defined currencies*, and SAP does not treat them as valid for FI postings or functional currency roles.

Having said that one option is stick with currency types 10, 30, or 60 for functional currency setup. If you need Z1 for reporting or analytics, you can still use it as a freely defined currency in the ledger — just not as the functional currency.

If your goal is to report in a different currency (e.g., USD for an INR company), use currency type 30 or 60 and configure the ledger to include that currency. For analytics, you can use Z1 in Universal Journal (ACDOCA) as a freely defined currency and build reports on it.
